questions.question: What are the three approaches involved in AP Research?
Which of the following usually involves pre-tests, post-tests, and random assignment?
Which doesn't include a large measure of control and is usually assigned to case studies?
Which of the following statements is an example of qualitative methodology?

choices.answer: I want to know what causes something else.
I want to describe the context in a lot of detail.
I want to make sure others can repeat my findings.
I wonder how small patterns generalize to big patterns.

questions.question: Which of the following statements is an example of quantitative methodology?

choices.answer: I want to describe the context in a lot of detail.
I want to show how social change occurs.
I want to see the world through the eyes of my respondents.
I wonder how small patterns generalize to big patterns.

questions.question: Which of the following is a qualitative purpose/feature?
Which of the following is a quantitative purpose/feature?

choices.answer: Aims to find insights into particular contexts
Aims to find insights into particular contexts

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of quantitative research methods?
Which of the following is an example of a qualitative research method?
Which of the following most accurately describes case study research?

choices.answer: The act of surveying a large range of people in one area.
Study of the past as it is described in written documents.
Statements based on something one has seen or heard.
Empirical inquiry that investigates contemporary phenomena.

questions.question: Which is an advantage of primary research?

choices.answer: Researcher can focus on qualitative/quantitative issues.
It is usually quicker to find.
Somebody has done all the legwork for you.
It is generally the cheaper option.

questions.question: Which of the following is a advantage of Secondary Research?

choices.answer: Researcher can focus on qualitative/quantitative issues
It is usually quicker to find
The researcher controls the design to fit their needs

questions.question: Which of the following most accurately describes primary research?

choices.answer: Involves collecting data through fieldwork or trials
High response rate has to be expected

questions.question: Qualitative, quantitative, or mixed methods are explicit in...
Which of the following describes ethnography?

choices.answer: Researcher immerses him/herself in life of people in exprmt
Empirical inquiry that investigates contemporary phenomena
Researcher extrapolates data from multiple sources
Researcher randomly asks questions to people who fit a model
